CodeExample.Title: Get the Conversation/Threads collection
CodeExample.Summary: To get the Conversation/Threads collection, submit an HTTP GET request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request: GET /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/Conversations/<Conversation.Id>/Threads HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose

Remarks.string: A successful response returns the 200 OK status code and a body containing a collection of the ConversationThread resource representations.

CodeExample.Title: Add an item to the Conversation/Threads collection
CodeExample.Summary: To add an item to the Conversation/Threads collection, submit an HTTP POST request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
POST /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/Conversations/<Conversation.Id>/Threads HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <ConversationThread.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <ConversationThread.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body must contain the properties required to add a ConversationThread entity to the Conversation's Threads collection. The successful response returns a 201 Created status code, with a payload containing the newly created ConversationThread resource representation.

CodeExample.Title: Update an item in the Conversation/Threads collection
CodeExample.Summary: To update an item in the Conversation/Threads collection, submit a PUT request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
PUT /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/Conversations/<Conversation.Id>/Threads HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <ConversationThread.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <ConversationThread.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body must contain properties without default values. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Modify an item in the Conversation/Threads collection
CodeExample.Summary: To modify an item in the Threads collection, submit an HTTP PATCH request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request:
PATCH /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/Conversations/<Conversation.Id>/Threads HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*' Content-Length : <body_length>
{ <ConversationThread.property_1> : <value_1>, ..., <ConversationThread.property_n> : <value_n> }

Remarks.string: The request body contains the to-be-modified properties with new values. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, without any payload.

CodeExample.Title: Delete an item from the Conversation/Threads collection
CodeExample.Summary: To delete an item from the Threads collection, submit an HTTP DELETE request of the following REST call syntax:
CodeExample.Request: DELETE /<version>/myOrganization/groups/<Group.objectId>/Conversations/<Conversation.Id>/Threads HTTP/1.1 Host : graph.microsoft.com Authorization : Bearer <access_token> Accept : application/json;odata=verbose If-Match : '*'

Remarks.string: The request contains no payload. The successful response returns a 204 No content status code, also without any payload.
